description:
THE PROBLEM: Current PPE is made out of watertight plastic, which makes them impervious to contaminated liquids but hot, sweaty, and uncomfortable to wear.

THE SOLUTION: Hydrophobic membranes are filtering materials that allow air to pass through but repel water.  If PPE gowns could be strategically vented (in armpits, etc.) with patches of hydrophobic membranes, the suits would be more breathable and healthcare workers would still be protected from contaminated bodily fluids.

CURRENT MATERIAL APPLICATIONS:
Hydrophobic membrane vents are currently available and used to protect electronics from moisture: http://www.gore.com/en_xx/products/venting/protective/protectivevents_faq.html

This material is also used for various medical filtering applications: 
http://www.pall.com/main/oem-materials-and-devices/product.page?id=3948

PRICE / FEASIBILITY:
I read here that current PPE suits are so sweltering that they can only be worn for 30-40 minutes at a time:
http://www.npr.org/blogs/goatsandsoda/2014/07/24/334948345/this-suit-keeps-ebola-out-so-how-can-a-health-worker-catch-it

Just for the sake of argument, here is a listing for some hydrophobic membrane material that costs roughly $10 per 90mm diameter disc of the material:
http://www.coleparmer.com/Product/Advantec_PTFE_Hydrophobic_Membranes_with_Support_90_mm_dia_0_20_m_25_PK/UX-02916-56?referred_id=778&mkwid=7Xk5t5x6&pcrid=49849374039&gclid=CjwKEAjw5NihBRCZmdLkuuTHyWYSJACtCY0J206VcWi6_u57RKKLi3eIdfSRHaqXyFPKQGM-HyrGOBoCadnw_wcB

That works out to about $3.13 per square inch based on a quick cursory search. It's a bit pricey, but it you add few small strategically placed patches and it extends the amount of time the healthcare worker is able to stand being inside the suit, it might justify the cost.
summary: Hydrophobic membranes are filtering materials that allow air to pass through but repel water.  If PPE gowns could be strategically vented (in armpits, etc.) with patches of hydrophobic membranes, the suits would be more breathable and healthcare workers would still be protected from contaminated bodily fluids.
title: Hydrophobic Membrane Vents for PPE Clothing - Let air through but repel liquids
